base_note.note_text:
THERAPEUTIC BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-04-14
Patient: Elizabeth Morgan | MRN: 6330785 | Age: 59F
Attending: Dr. Kevin Park, MD
Fellow: Dr. Jennifer Walsh, MD (PGY-6)
Location: MD Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX

INDICATION: Stage IIIB non-small cell lung cancer with near-complete obstruction of left mainstem bronchus causing post-obstructive pneumonia and respiratory failure. Palliative airway recanalization.

PROCEDURE:
1. Rigid bronchoscopy
2. Tumor debulking with rigid coring/mechanical debridement
3. Argon plasma coagulation (APC) for hemostasis and tumor ablation
4. Balloon dilation
5. Silicone stent placement, left mainstem

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia, jet ventilation

FINDINGS & PROCEDURE:
Under GA, rigid bronchoscope (12mm Dumon) introduced. 
- Trachea: Patent
- Carina: Normal
- Right lung: Patent
- Left mainstem: >95% occluded by exophytic, necrotic tumor arising from posterolateral wall

TUMOR DEBULKING:
Rigid coring performed to remove bulk of intraluminal tumor. Significant necrotic debris evacuated. APC (ERBE, 40W) applied for hemostasis and ablation of residual tumor at margins. Estimated 80% tumor removed with resulting lumen ~10mm.

BALLOON DILATION:
CRE balloon (15mm x 40mm) used to dilate narrowed segment to accept stent. 3 inflations at 6 ATM.

STENT PLACEMENT:
Novatech Dumon silicone stent (14mm x 40mm) deployed over the debulked segment. Good expansion. Proximal and distal ends 1cm beyond visible tumor.

POST-PROCEDURE:
- Pre-obstruction: >95%
- Post-procedure: <20% (patent stent lumen)
- LLL and lingula now ventilated

SPECIMENS: Tumor fragments to surgical pathology
COMPLICATIONS: Moderate bleeding - controlled with APC
EBL: 75mL
DISPOSITION: SICU overnight then step-down

Dr. Kevin Park, MD

code_rationales.31641: Tumor destruction/debulking using mechanical and APC modalities
code_rationales.31630: Balloon dilation - may require modifier if at same site as stent per NCCI

coding_review.overall_assessment: Complex CAO with multimodal debulking and stent placement for malignant obstruction.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus
Bronchoscopy; with tracheal/bronchial dilation or closed reduction of fracture

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31641, 31636, 31630; total_work_rvu=13.36, total_rvu=21.52 (facility).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Jonathan Hall
Medical Record Number: 8099790
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-07-29

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with nsclc with near-complete lms obstruction. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Cao Debulking:

Airway Stent:
Airway stent deployment was executed with fluoroscopic and bronchoscopic guidance to ensure optimal positioning and mucosal apposition. 
Dilation:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
& PROCEDURE:
Under GA, rigid bronchoscope (12mm Dumon) introduced. 
- Trachea: Patent
- Carina: Normal
- Right lung: Patent
- Left mainstem: >95% occluded by exophytic, necrotic tumor arising from posterolateral wall


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31641, 31636, 31630

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

None

To recovery, stable condition

variations.note_text:
On 2025-05-08, Rebecca Wang, a None-year-old patient (MRN 9431087), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for NSCLC with near-complete LMS obstruction. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included cao debulking, placement of Silicone - Dumon, and dilation. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The visualized airways appeared patent without significant abnormality. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is malignancy. 

Procedural coding: 31641, 31636, 31630.

THERAPEUTIC BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2024-10-03
Patient: Lauren Butler | MRN: 7082747 | Age: 59F
Attending: Dr. Kevin Park, MD
Fellow: Dr. Jennifer Walsh, MD (PGY-6)
Location: MD Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX

INDICATION: Stage IIIB non-small cell lung cancer with near-complete obstruction of left mainstem bronchus causing post-obstructive pneumonia and respiratory failure. Palliative airway recanalization.

PROCEDURE:
1. Rigid bronchoscopy
2. Tumor debulking with rigid coring/mechanical debridement
3. Argon plasma coagulation (APC) for hemostasis and tumor ablation
4. Balloon dilation
5. Silicone stent placement, left mainstem

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia, jet ventilation

FINDINGS & PROCEDURE:
Under GA, rigid bronchoscope (12mm Dumon) introduced. 
- Trachea: Navigable
- Carina: Normal
- Right lung: Navigable
- Left mainstem: >95% occluded by exophytic, necrotic tumor arising from posterolateral wall

TUMOR DEBULKING:
Rigid coring carried out to remove bulk of intraluminal tumor. Significant necrotic debris evacuated. APC (ERBE, 40W) applied for hemostasis and ablation of residual tumor at margins. Estimated 80% tumor eliminated with resulting lumen ~10mm.

BALLOON DILATION:
CRE balloon (15mm x 40mm) used to dilate narrowed segment to accept stent. 3 inflations at 6 ATM.

STENT PLACEMENT:
Novatech Dumon silicone stent (14mm x 40mm) installed over the debulked segment. Good expansion. Proximal and distal ends 1cm beyond visible tumor.

POST-PROCEDURE:
- Pre-obstruction: >95%
- Post-procedure: <20% (navigable stent lumen)
- LLL and lingula now ventilated

SPECIMENS: Tumor fragments to surgical pathology
COMPLICATIONS: Moderate bleeding - controlled with APC
EBL: 75mL
DISPOSITION: SICU overnight then step-down

Dr. Kevin Park, MD
